category.name: Localization
category.category_description: No description available for this category.

preference.name: TC_language_data_entry
preference.preference_description: Defines which locales users may use for data entry. Limit the values of this preference to locales supported by your database encoding. When this preference is set, the system displays the following message after a user enters the appropriate credentials: You must limit data input using locales L10N_a and L10N_b.L10N_a and L10N_b are values set for this preference. The system implements this preference as follows:If the requested locale does not exist on the Teamcenter server, the connection is served in English. If the requested locale does not belong to the database encoding, and the Teamcenter server is running on a UTF-8 system (for example, Linux), the connection is served with this locale. If the requested locale does not belong to the database encoding, and the Teamcenter server is running on a non-UTF-8 system, the connection is served in English. If none of these situations apply, the requested locale is served. Valid Values: cs_CZ - Czech de_DE - German en_US - English es_ES - Spanish fr_FR - French it_IT - Italian ja_JP - Japanese ko_KR - Korean ru_RU - Russian zh_CN - Chinese (as spoken in China) zh_TW - Chinese (as spoken in Taiwan)
